intro: Argythamnia tinctoria, commonly known as the dyer's mallot. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, belonging to the family Asteraceae. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The species is noted for its potential use in traditional dyeing practices due to the presence of certain chemical compounds in its leaves.
